_meta.description: UK tax rates, National Insurance, and state benefit rates. UPDATE EACH APRIL when new tax year rates are published.

nationalInsurance.description: Employee Class 1 NI contributions: 8% on earnings between threshold and upper limit, 2% above.

statutorySickPay.description: SSP paid by employer to PAYE employees. £123.25/week (or 80% of AWE, whichever is lower) for up to 28 weeks.
statutorySickPay.note: Self-employed are NOT eligible for SSP.

assessmentPhase.description: New Style ESA assessment phase (first 13 weeks), age 25+. Contribution-based, not means-tested.

supportGroup.description: New Style ESA support group rate (basic allowance + support component).

employmentSupportAllowance.eligibility: Available to employed and self-employed if sufficient Class 1 or Class 2 NI contributions paid.
employmentSupportAllowance.note: New Style ESA can be claimed alongside Universal Credit.

universalCredit.description: UC is means-tested. Standard allowance plus Limited Capability for Work-Related Activity (LCWRA) element if assessed as having limited capability for work.
universalCredit.note: Actual UC amount depends on household income, savings (>£6k reduces), rent, children, and other factors.
